DataElement.preferredDefinition: Text term to describe the severe combined immunodeficiency.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: X-linked or autosomal recessive disorder characterized by defects of both humoral and cell mediated immunity, resulting in low or absent antibody levels, leukopenia, marked susceptibility to infections, and early death.--2004_A written or verbal account, representation, statement, or explanation of something.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: X-linked or autosomal recessive disorder characterized by defects of both humoral and cell mediated immunity, resulting in low or absent antibody levels, leukopenia, marked susceptibility to infections, and early death.--2004

Concepts.definition: X-linked or autosomal recessive disorder characterized by defects of both humoral and cell mediated immunity, resulting in low or absent antibody levels, leukopenia, marked susceptibility to infections, and early death.--2004

Property.preferredDefinition: A statement or an account describing something.

Concepts.definition: A written or verbal account, representation, statement, or explanation of something.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Specification of human conditions relevant to cancer. This includes observations, test results, history, and other concepts relevant to characterization of human cancer-related conditions. Non-neoplastic conditions of interest are also included.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 2020-12-15 AK Created for NCI-INC0536652 - 20C0070 Curation and import 11.10.2020

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: X-linked or autosomal recessive disorder characterized by defects of both humoral and cell mediated immunity, resulting in low or absent antibody levels, leukopenia, marked susceptibility to infections, and early death.--2004_The words or language units by which a thing is known.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: T-Cells and B-Cells Absent and Natural Killer Cells Normal

ValueMeaning.preferredName: T-Cells and B-Cells Absent and Natural Killer Cells Normal
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A hematology test result indicating that a subject has a normal amount of natural killer cells but B-cells and T-cells are either absent or found at abnormally low amounts.

Concepts.longName: T-Cells and B-Cells Absent and Natural Killer Cells Normal
Concepts.definition: A hematology test result indicating that a subject has a normal amount of natural killer cells but B-cells and T-cells are either absent or found at abnormally low amounts.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: T-Cells Absent and Normal Natural Killer Cells and B-Cells

ValueMeaning.preferredName: T-Cells Absent and Normal Natural Killer Cells and B-Cells
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A hematology test result indicating that a subject has a normal amount of B-cells and natural killer cells but T-cells are either absent or found at abnormally low amounts.

Concepts.longName: T-Cells Absent and Normal Natural Killer Cells and B-Cells
Concepts.definition: A hematology test result indicating that a subject has a normal amount of B-cells and natural killer cells but T-cells are either absent or found at abnormally low amounts.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: T-Cells Absent, T-Cell Receptor Signaling Defective and Natural Killer Cells and B-Cells Normal

ValueMeaning.preferredName: T-Cells Absent, T-Cell Receptor Signaling Defective and Natural Killer Cells and B-Cells Normal
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A hematology test result indicating that a subject has a normal amount of B-cells and natural killer cells but T-cells are absent or found at abnormally low amounts and a defect in T-cell receptor signaling pathways has been observed.

Concepts.longName: T-Cells Absent, T-Cell Receptor Signaling Defective and Natural Killer Cells and B-Cells Normal
Concepts.definition: A hematology test result indicating that a subject has a normal amount of B-cells and natural killer cells but T-cells are absent or found at abnormally low amounts and a defect in T-cell receptor signaling pathways has been observed.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: T-Cells and Natural Killer Cells Absent B-Cells Normal

ValueMeaning.preferredName: T-Cells and Natural Killer Cells Absent B-Cells Normal
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A hematology test result indicating that a subject has a normal amount of B-cells but both T-cells and natural killer cells are either absent or found at abnormally low amounts.

Concepts.longName: T-Cells and Natural Killer Cells Absent B-Cells Normal
Concepts.definition: A hematology test result indicating that a subject has a normal amount of B-cells but both T-cells and natural killer cells are either absent or found at abnormally low amounts.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: T-Cells, B-Cells and Natural Killer Cells Absent

ValueMeaning.preferredName: T-Cells, B-Cells and Natural Killer Cells Absent
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A hematology test result indicating that a subject's T-cells, B-cells and natural killer cells are either absent or found at abnormally low amounts.

Concepts.longName: T-Cells, B-Cells and Natural Killer Cells Absent
Concepts.definition: A hematology test result indicating that a subject's T-cells, B-cells and natural killer cells are either absent or found at abnormally low amounts.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Specification of human conditions relevant to cancer. This includes observations, test results, history, and other concepts relevant to characterization of human cancer-related conditions. Non-neoplastic conditions of interest are also included.

Concepts.definition: X-linked or autosomal recessive disorder characterized by defects of both humoral and cell mediated immunity, resulting in low or absent antibody levels, leukopenia, marked susceptibility to infections, and early death.--2004
The words or language units by which a thing is known.
